title: Money
subtitle: Understanding Society Through Money
introduction: Money is the foundation of civilization, the hidden language of human cooperation. It's not just a medium of exchange, but the crystallization of trust, power, and value. Bitcoin, as the first truly scarce digital commodity, is redefining our understanding of money. This transformation is not only technological but also touches the very fabric of social organization.

sections.title: The Nature of Money: Evolution of Medium of Exchange

content.subtitle: Core Functions of Money
points: Medium of Exchange: Facilitates exchange of goods and services, solving the double coincidence of wants problem
Unit of Account: Provides a unified pricing unit for comparing value of goods
Store of Value: Preserves purchasing power over time, hedging against inflation
Standard of Deferred Payment: Pricing standard for debts and contracts

content.subtitle: Characteristics of Good Money
points: Scarcity: Limited and predictable supply
Durability: Resistant to decay or damage
Divisibility: Can be divided into small units
Portability: Easy to transport and transfer
Verifiability: Authenticity easily verified
Fungibility: Units are perfectly interchangeable

sections.title: Monetary Evolution: From Physical to Digital

content.subtitle: Historical Development Stages
points: Commodity Money: Shells, salt, livestock and other items with intrinsic value
Metal Money: Gold and silver became primary currencies due to scarcity and divisibility
Representative Money: Paper notes representing a certain amount of precious metals
Fiat Currency: Government-issued currency without intrinsic value
Digital Currency: Decentralized digital currency pioneered by Bitcoin

content.subtitle: Drivers of Each Revolution
points: Technological Progress: Improving physical properties of money
Transaction Needs: Reducing transaction costs and complexity
Political Requirements: Government control over money supply
Globalization: Convenience needs for cross-border trade

content.subtitle: Technology-Enabled Advantages
points: Absolute Scarcity: Fixed cap of 21 million coins, more predictable than gold
Ultimate Divisibility: Can be divided to 8 decimal places (1 satoshi = 0.00000001 BTC)
Borderless Portability: Digital form, no physical limits on cross-border transfers
Eternal Durability: As long as the network exists, Bitcoin never degrades
Cryptographic Verification: Quick authenticity verification through cryptography
Protocol Uniformity: Every Bitcoin is identical at the protocol level

content.subtitle: Comparison with Traditional Money
points: Gold vs Bitcoin: Digital gold has more verifiable scarcity
Fiat vs Bitcoin: Decentralized vs centralized control
Banking System vs Blockchain: Intermediated vs disintermediated
Physical vs Digital: Fundamental differences in storage and transfer

content.subtitle: Bad Money Drives Out Good
points: Classic Theory: People tend to spend depreciating currency and save appreciating currency
Bitcoin Phenomenon: As "good money" it tends to be saved rather than circulated
Dual Role: Both a store of value and medium of exchange
Time Preference: Low time preference individuals tend to hold Bitcoin

content.subtitle: New Landscape of Monetary Competition
points: Multiple Choices: Coexistence of fiat, gold, and Bitcoin
Market Selection: Users choose different currencies based on needs
Network Effects: The more users, the greater the value
Institutional Competition: Survival of the fittest among different monetary systems

sections.title: Monetary Policy Revolution: Algorithm vs Human Control

content.subtitle: Traditional Monetary Policy
points: Central Bank Control: Managing economy through interest rates and money supply
Subjective Decisions: Based on economic theory and political considerations
Flexibility: Policy can be adjusted according to circumstances
Moral Hazard: May be captured by political interests

content.subtitle: Bitcoin's Algorithmic Governance
points: Code is Law: Algorithmic monetary policy, immune to human intervention
Predictability: Supply schedule is completely transparent and certain
Deflationary Design: Long-term deflation vs fiat's inflationary tendency
Depoliticization: Monetary policy unaffected by political cycles

sections.title: Monetary Network Effects: From Acceptance to Adoption

content.subtitle: Adoption Process
points: Early Adopters: Tech experts and speculators
Merchant Acceptance: Addition of payment options
User Growth: Enhancement of network value
Institutional Adoption: Participation by corporations and governments

content.subtitle: Infrastructure Development
points: Payment Systems: Wallets and payment processors
Exchanges: Fiat to Bitcoin conversion
Financial Services: Lending and derivatives markets
Regulatory Framework: Clarification of legal status

keyInsights: Money is a Social Consensus: Any money derives value from social consensus, Bitcoin consensus is algorithmic
Scarcity is Key: Bitcoin proves scarcity creates not only value but also trust
From Physical to Digital: Currency digitization is irreversible, Bitcoin is the ultimate digital form
Neutrality of Money: Bitcoin is the world's first politically neutral currency
